title: The best PopSocket ever might not be a PopSocket
description: This $40 magnetic phone grip and stand does what PopSockets can't -- the Ohsnap Snap 4 is thinner than a camera bump, has more ways to hold it, and you can keep it on while using MagSafe chargers and accessories. transcript: Today I'm toying with an incredibly thin disc that's basically the best popsocket ever made. The Ohsnap Snap 4 is so much thinner, thinner than the camera bumps on many phones. But this one lifts, spins, supports so many different types of grips. And you don't need to take it off to get wireless charging or stick it to a fridge. How's it so thin? Little flexible arms on the inside criss cross as they fold, they stretch to fit a finger inside for a firmer grip. They bend when you notch the disc in place when you turn it into a stand. And they're strong. I've yanked on them repeatedly for weeks without breakage. Caveats: It can dramatically slow down wirless charging, particularly if you use a thick case. It relies on adhesive, not just magnets, because strong Magsafe mounts can overpower its own magnets. The disc can feel a little sharp, and at 40 bucks, it ain't cheap. It's just not as pretty as a good PopSocket, nor as personizable. Though these colors are pretty great.
